intro: Euonymus alatus f. microphyllus, commonly known as the creeping euonymus, is a compact, low-growing shrub native to eastern Asia. It features small, oval-shaped leaves that are typically dark green on top and lighter underneath. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers in the spring, followed by orange-red蒴果 that split open to reveal bright red seeds. It is often used in landscaping for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in shaded environments. Its foliage and fruit make it an attractive choice for gardeners seeking a hardy, decorative plant.
